metadata.title: Home
metadata.summary: Visit BBC News for up-to-the-minute news, breaking news, video, audio and feature stories. BBC News provides trusted World and UK news as well as local and regional perspectives. Also entertainment, business, science, technology and health news.

headlines.headline: Ukraine's elections: Five things to know

items.summary: A look at some of the odder facts about Sunday's presidential elections in Ukraine.

media.title: Ukraine's elections: five things to know

synopses.short: Ukraine's presidential elections: five things to know
synopses.long:
The seventh presidential elections in Ukraine will take place on Sunday 31 March. 
Among the candidates are popular comic actor Volodymyr Zelenskiy, current president , "chocolate king" Petro Poroshenko, and former prime minister Yulia Tymoshenko.
Here are five fun facts about the election.
synopses.medium: The seventh presidential elections in Ukraine will take place on 31 March.

media.caption: Ukraine's presidential elections: five things to know

headlines.headline: Rare tiger cubs make debut at Sydney Zoo

items.summary: The 10-week-old cubs - one male and two females - belong to a critically endangered sub-species.

media.title: Rare tiger cubs make debut at Sydney Zoo

synopses.short: Meet the rare tiger cubs making their debut at Sydney Zoo
synopses.long:
Three rare Sumatran tiger cubs are being introduced to the public for the first time at the Taronga Zoo in Sydney. 

The 10-week-old cubs - one male and two females - are part of the critically endangered sub-species, which only has less than 400 wild tigers left on the Indonesian island of Sumatra.

The little tigers were born to an eight-year-old tiger on 17 January, as part of a regional breeding programme for Sumatran tigers.
synopses.medium: The three 10-week-old Sumatran tiger cubs - one male and two females - are critically endangered.

media.caption: Meet the rare Sumatran tigers making their public debut

indexImage.altText: Three tiger cubs at Sydney Zoo

headlines.headline: May: 'A matter of profound regret'

items.summary: Theresa May says the rejection of the EU withdrawal agreement will have "grave" implications.

media.title: May: 'A matter of profound regret'

synopses.short: Theresa May: 'A matter of profound regret'
synopses.long:
Theresa May’s EU withdrawal agreement has been rejected by 344 votes to 286, a majority of 58 - throwing the UK’s Brexit plans into more confusion.
The prime minister said it was a "matter of profound regret that once again this House been unable to support leaving the European Union in an orderly way".
synopses.medium: Theresa May says the rejection of the EU withdrawal agreement will have "grave" implications.

media.caption: Theresa May: The rejection of the EU withdrawal agreement will have "grave" implications

headlines.headline: The twinning project tackling Brexit divisions

items.summary: BBC Breakfast looks at an initiative bringing together voters on both sides of the Brexit debate.

media.title: The twinning project tackling Brexit divisions

synopses.short: More in Common - how voters are bridging the Brexit divide
synopses.long:
Brexit remains a deeply divisive issue on the day the UK was meant to leave the EU.
But two groups from the highest leave voting area, Boston and the highest remain voting area, Lambeth have been visiting each other's home towns to try to build bridges and understand different points of view. 
BBC Breakfast went to see what the participants had gained from the experience.
synopses.medium: BBC Breakfast looks at an initiative bringing together voters on both sides of the Brexit debate.

media.caption: The More in Common initiative brings voters on both sides of the Brexit divide together

headlines.headline: 'I never want to hear the word Brexit again'

items.summary: An artist is recording people's voicemails about Europe in his Brexit phonebox.

media.title: 'I never want to hear the word Brexit again'

synopses.short: Brexit: People's messages to Europe in Kent phonebox
synopses.long:
People have been leaving voicemails to the EU in a special Brexit phonebox in Kent.

The metal box - called +44 Leave A Message for Europe - is an art installation by artist Joe Sweeney.

He says it will be important in the future to be able to listen back to what people were saying about Brexit at the time.

Video journalist: Tyler Anderson
synopses.medium: An artist is recording people's voicemails about Europe in his Brexit phonebox.

media.caption: 'I never want to hear the word Brexit again'

headlines.headline: Band killed in crash were 'lovely, lovely men'

items.summary: Radio 1 DJ Huw Stephens says Liverpool duo Her's were "sweet friends" who made "sweet music".

media.title: Band killed in crash were 'lovely, lovely men'

synopses.short: Her's: Band killed in crash were 'lovely, lovely men'
synopses.long:
Radio 1 DJ Huw Stephens has paid tribute to both members of the band Her's - who died in a car crash in the US.

Stephen Fitzpatrick, 24, and Audun Laading, 25, died along with their tour manager Trevor Engelbrektson.

They were travelling to a gig in California.

Huw has told Radio 1 Newsbeat the two "sweet friends", who had been backed by BBC Introducing, had a bright future in music ahead of them.
synopses.medium: Radio 1 DJ Huw Stephens says Liverpool duo Her's were "sweet friends" who made "sweet music".

media.caption: Band killed in crash were 'lovely, lovely men'

indexImage.altText: Stephen Fitzpatrick and Audun Laading from the band Her's

headlines.headline: 'We've marched 270 miles for Brexit'

items.summary: Brexit supporters on the March to Leave walk are reaching Westminster. We met them during the journey.

media.title: 'We've marched 270 miles for Brexit'

synopses.short: The Leavers marching 270 miles to ‘ensure we Brexit’
synopses.long:
Brexit supporters on the March to Leave campaign are reaching Westminster on Friday.

The Victoria Derbyshire programme's James Waterhouse met them during the journey, which began in Sunderland two weeks ago, with around 100 individuals on their way.
synopses.medium: Brexit supporters on the March to Leave walk are reaching Westminster. We met them during the journey.

media.caption: The Leavers marching 270 miles to ‘ensure we Brexit’

indexImage.copyrightHolder: Brexit supporters on the March to Leave campaign a

headlines.headline: 'Visionary' Banksy painting back on show

items.summary: Devolved Parliament, his biggest known work on canvas, depicts politicians as chimpanzees.

media.title: 'Visionary' Banksy painting back on show

synopses.short: Banksy: Devolved Parliament back on show at Bristol Museum
synopses.long:
A Banksy painting is back on display 10 years after the artist's wildly popular exhibition at Bristol Museum.
Devolved Parliament, his biggest known work on canvas, depicts politicians in the House of Commons as chimpanzees. 
It will be on display until September as part of the 10th anniversary celebrations of the Banksy vs Bristol Museum exhibition and is on loan from a private collection.
But what do visitors think of the painting in the light of recent parliamentary proceedings?
synopses.medium: Devolved Parliament, his biggest known work on canvas, depicts politicians as chimpanzees.

media.caption: Banksy: Devolved Parliament back on show at Bristol Museum
